lg.l: NYT Aug 9 1961 "Stage Actor, Dies: Top Chinese Star Was Noted Female Impersonator."New York Times (9 August 1961): 33. Obituary for Mei Lan-Fang, 67. The piece clarifies that the title "Foremost of the Peach Orchard" indicated that Mei was "without a peer as an actor in China." The actor emerged from retirement after WWII and became a deputy of the National People's Congress in 1955; he did not join the Communist Party until 1959.

lg.l: R Southey Southey, Robert [1774-1843]. English poet, associated with Romanticism. Moore pastes in a section of a newspaper article on his work that she apparently clipped in 1916 and retained. It is comprised of two of Southey's poems, "The Locust" and "The Sea Anemone," with annotations, presumably hers. We reproduce here only her notes and the lines she annotates. NY. Times May 7) 1916

May 7, 1916 Artz, V. T."Letters from Book Review Readers." New York Times (7 May 1916): B197. Letter to the editor defending the continued value of Southey's poetry in 1916, and the view that he is still appreciated by some discriminating readers.

l.note: MM travelled to Europe by boat in 1962 with college friend Frances Browne and Frances's sister Norvelle, departing July 25, returning October 11. They visited Azores, Madeira, Lisbon, Majorca, Italy, and Greece. Some notes here were made on that trip, including Italian language practice.The purser lectured the group on the sites they would visit.
